perturbation.original_text: A 1/40t h or 2.50% undivided beneficial ownership interest in each Series E Debt Security having a principal amount of $1,000 is part of a common equity unit (each, a "Unit"), which currently includes one stock purchase contract (the "Stock Purchase Contract") which was issued pursuant to the Stock Purchase Contract Agreement, dated as of November 1, 2010, as amended and supplemented by Supplemental Agreement No. 1, dated June 26, 2013, between the Company and the Stock Purchase Contract Agent (as so amended and supplemented, the "Stock Purchase Contract Agreement"), between the Company and Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, as stock purchase contract agent (the "Stock Purchase Contract Agent"), and under which the holder of the Unit is obligated to purchase from the Company on the Third Stock Purchase Date (as defined in the Stock Purchase Contract Agreement), for $25.00 per Stock Purchase Contract, a number of shares of common stock, par value $0.01 per share, of the Company (the "Common Stock"), equal to the applicable Settlement Rate as set forth in the Stock Purchase Contract Agreement. The ownership interests in the Series E Debt Securities or, if the holder has stripped such Unit, designated zero-coupon U.S. Treasury Securities, have been pledged to secure the obligations to purchase Common Stock on the Third Stock Purchase Date (as defined in the Stock Purchase Contract Agreement) pursuant to the Stock Purchase Contract. The terms and conditions of such pledge are set forth in the Pledge Agreement, dated as of November 1, 2010 (the "Pledge Agreement"), among the Company, Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, as collateral agent (the "Collateral Agent"), custodial agent (the "Custodial Agent") and securities intermediary (the "Securities Intermediary"), and the Stock Purchase Contract Agent.
perturbation.changed_text: A 1/40t h or 2.50% undivided beneficial ownership interest in each Series E Debt Security having a principal amount of $1,000 may be considered as part of a common equity unit (each, a "Unit"), which may include one stock purchase contract (the "Stock Purchase Contract") which was issued pursuant to the Stock Purchase Contract Agreement, dated as of November 1, 2010, as amended and supplemented by Supplemental Agreement No. 1, dated June 26, 2013, between the Company and the Stock Purchase Contract Agent (as so amended and supplemented, the "Stock Purchase Contract Agreement"), between the Company and Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, as stock purchase contract agent (the "Stock Purchase Contract Agent"), and under which the holder of the Unit is required to purchase from the Company on the Third Stock Purchase Date (as defined in the Stock Purchase Contract Agreement), for an amount to be determined per Stock Purchase Contract, a number of shares of common stock, par value $0.01 per share, of the Company (the "Common Stock"), as determined by the Company. The ownership interests in the Series E Debt Securities or, if the holder has stripped such Unit, designated zero-coupon U.S. Treasury Securities, are eligible to be pledged to secure the obligations to purchase Common Stock on the Third Stock Purchase Date (as defined in the Stock Purchase Contract Agreement) pursuant to the Stock Purchase Contract. The terms and conditions of such pledge will be decided in the Pledge Agreement, dated as of November 1, 2010 (the "Pledge Agreement"), among the Company, Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, as collateral agent (the "Collateral Agent"), custodial agent (the "Custodial Agent") and securities intermediary (the "Securities Intermediary"), and the Stock Purchase Contract Agent.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that a portion of each Series E Debt Security is *part* of a common equity unit that *includes* a stock purchase contract for a defined value. The text also stated that ownership interests *have been pledged* to secure obligations. The changed text makes the inclusion of a stock purchase contract *conditional*, removes the price from the purchase contract, says the ownership interests *are eligible* to be pledged, and says that the terms *will be decided* in the pledge agreement. This creates in-text contradictions by moving from statements of fact to conditional possibilities, which undermines certainty about the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Effective on September 15, 2014, the Series E Debt Securities will automatically convert, without any act of any holder, into units consisting of two tranches, with each $2,000 principal amount of Series E Debt Securities thereafter consisting of $1,000 principal amount of First Tranche Series E Debt Securities and $1,000 principal amount of Second Tranche Series E Debt Securities.
perturbation.changed_text: Effective on September 15, 2014, the Series E Debt Securities may convert, subject to company discretion, without any act of any holder, into units consisting of two tranches, with each $2,000 principal amount of Series E Debt Securities possibly consisting of $1,000 principal amount of First Tranche Series E Debt Securities and $1,000 principal amount of Second Tranche Series E Debt Securities.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that the debt securities *will automatically convert*. The modified version creates uncertainty by changing this to the securities *may convert, subject to company discretion*. The modified language also changes 'consisting of' to 'possibly consisting of' to indicate ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text:
1. Appointment and Obligations of the Remarketing Agents. (a) The Company hereby appoints Deutsche Bank as the initial Remarketing Agent, and Deutsche   3

Bank hereby accepts appointment as Remarketing Agent, for the purpose of (i) Remarketing the Remarketed Securities on behalf of the holders thereof, (ii) establishing the Reset Rates (as defined below) for the Securities in connection with the Remarketing and (iii) performing such other duties as are assigned to the Remarketing Agents in the Remarketing Procedures, all in accordance with and pursuant to the Remarketing Procedures.
perturbation.changed_text: 1. Appointment and Obligations of the Remarketing Agents. (a) The Company may appoint Deutsche Bank as a Remarketing Agent, and Deutsche Bank may accept appointment as Remarketing Agent, for the potential purpose of (i) Remarketing the Remarketed Securities, (ii) tentatively establishing the Reset Rates (as defined below) for the Securities in connection with the Remarketing and (iii) possibly performing other duties, subject to further agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly *appoints* Deutsche Bank and states they *accept* the appointment for specific purposes. The modified version removes this certainty by stating the Company *may appoint* and Deutsche Bank *may accept*, and rewords the purpose of the engagement to be potential/tentative and subject to further agreement. This creates contradiction by making the appointment and responsibilities ambiguous.
